lesson_01.Title: Looking for the reception
lesson_01.Info: If you want to ask for the reception...
lesson_01.Translation: Excuse me, where is the reception?
lesson_01.Memo: Recepcija is domesticated version of the same international word, not hard to remember.

lesson_02.Title: Asking for a room
lesson_02.Info: If you need a room, you may say...
lesson_02.Memo:
We have cases in our language. A room in the nominative case is "soba". Here we have "sobu" in the accusative case.
As mentioned earlier, we change verbs by gender, therefore we don't need to use personal pronouns. You could also say:
"Ja trebam sobu" in the given example, but "Trebam sobu" is sufficient and gramatically correct.

lesson_03.Title: Room sizes
lesson_03.Memo:
The long words from the given example are combined words made from words for numbers:
"Jedan" = "One" and
"Dva" = "Two",
and the word for bed - "Krevet".

lesson_04.Title: Giving the keys
lesson_04.Info: While giving you a room key, a receptionist might say...
lesson_04.Memo:
One key is "ključ". 
Today most of the hotels use doors with cards instead of keys. For a "room card" we say "kartica od sobe" or just "kartica".

lesson_05.Title: Giving the room number
lesson_05.Info: To tell what your room number is...
lesson_05.Memo: Here the word for room "soba" is in genitive case and so it's "sobe".

lesson_06.Title: Asking for currency exchange
lesson_06.Info: To ask where the currency exchange is...
lesson_06.Translation: Where can I change the money?
lesson_06.Memo: The word for currency exchange office is "mjenjačnica". So you could also ask: "Gdje je mjenjačnica?" - "Where is a currency exchange office?".

lesson_07.Title: Asking for the restoraunt working hours
lesson_07.Info: To ask when the restaurant opens...
lesson_07.Memo:
Two useful words to remember:
"Otvoreno" = "Open"
"Zatvoreno" = Closed"

lesson_08.Title: Meals
lesson_08.Info: The names of the main meals are...
lesson_08.Memo:
"Do" in "Doručak" means "next to", because brekfast is next to, or before the lunch.
The word for dinner - "večera" comes from the word for evening - "večer", which you already know from the greeting "Dobra večer!"

lesson_09.Title: Asking for the pool
lesson_09.Info: To ask for children swimming pool...
lesson_09.Translation: Do you have a swimming pool for kids?
lesson_09.Memo: Swimming pool for children is also called "dječji bazen".

lesson_10.Title: Having the reservation
lesson_10.Info: To tell that you have a reservation for a room...
lesson_10.Memo:
"To have" is an important verb, so let's learn it in Croatian:
"I have" = "Imam"
"You have" = "Imaš"
"He/she has" = "Ima"
"We have" = "Imamo"
"You have" = "Imate"
"They have" = "Imaju"

lesson_11.Title: Asking for room maid
lesson_11.Phrase: Molim vas, pošaljite sobaricu u moju sobu.
lesson_11.Info: To ask for a room maid...
lesson_11.Translation: Please send a maid to my room.
lesson_11.Memo: If you remembered the word for room - "soba", it's gonna be easy to remember "sobarica" - "room maid".
